anumuh anu-√muh

to feel distressed at , to be troubled about or after another MBh. i , 143. _ MW004965 37,1 L=7004

to follow in death TBr. &c. _ MW004966 37,1 L=7005

antar anta'r

ind. within , between , amongst , in the middle or interior. (As a prep. with loc.) in the middle , in , between , into ; (with acc.) between ; (with gen.) in , in the middle. (ifc.) in , into , in the middle of , between , out of the midst of [cf. Zend $ ; Lat. inter ; Goth. undar]. _ MW005769 43,2 L=8048

antar antar

is sometimes compounded with a following word like an adjective , meaning interior , internal , intermediate. MW005770 43,2 L=8049

api a'pi

or sometimes pi (see pi-dRbh , pi-dhA , pi-nah) , expresses placing near or over , uniting to , annexing , reaching to , proximity , &c. [cf. Gk. $ Zd. api ; Germ. and Eng. prefix be] _ 55,1 L=10132

api a'pi

in later SanskRit its place seems frequently supplied by abhi. (As a separable adv.) and , also , moreover , besides , assuredly , surely _ 55,1 L=10132.1

api a'pi

api apiorapi-ca , as well as _ 55,1 L=10132.2

api a'pi

na vA^pi or na apivA or na nacA^pi , neither , nor , cA^pi , (and at the beginning of a sentence) api-ca , moreover. _ MW007345 55,1 L=10132.3

api api

is often used to express emphasis , in the sense of even , also , very _ 55,1 L=10133

api api

e.g. anyad api , also another , something more _ 55,1 L=10133.1

api api

adyA^pi , this very day , even now _ 55,1 L=10133.2

api api

tathA^pi , even thus , notwithstanding _ 55,1 L=10133.3

api api

yady api , even if , although _ 55,1 L=10133.4

api api

yadyapi tathA^pi , although , nevertheless _ 55,1 L=10133.5

api api

na kadAcid api , never at any time: sometimes in the sense of but , only , at least e.g. muhUrtam api , only a moment. _ MW007346 55,1 L=10133.6

api api

may be affixed to an interrogative to make it indefinite , e.g. ko 'pi , any one _ 55,1 L=10134

api api

kutrA^pi , anywhere. _ MW007347 55,1 L=10134.1

api api

imparts to numerals the notion of totality e.g. caturNam api varNAnAm , of all the four castes. _ MW007348 55,1 L=10135

api api

may be interrogative at the beginning of a sentence. _ MW007349 55,1 L=10136

api api

may strengthen the original force of the Potential , or may soften the Imperative , like the English ` be pleased to ' _ 55,1 L=10137

api api

sometimes it is a mere expletive. _ MW007350 55,1 L=10137.1

apsaras ap-sara's

As [ ṚV. AV. &c.] , or ap-sarA' [AV. &c.] , f. (fr. 2. a'p + √ sR) , ` going in the waters or between the waters of the clouds ' , a class of female divinities (sometimes called ` nymphs ' ; they inhabit the sky , but often visit the earth ; they are the wives of the Gandharvas (q.v.) and have the faculty of changing their shapes at will ; they are fond of the water ; one of their number , RambhA , is said to have been produced at the churning of the ocean). abhi abhi'

ind. (a prefix to verbs and nouns , expressing) to , towards , into , over , upon. (As a prefix to verbs of motion) it expresses the notion or going towards , approaching , &c. (As a prefix to nouns not derived from verbs) it expresses superiority , intensity , &c. _ 61,1 L=11185

abhi abhi'

ind. e.g. abhi-tAmra , abhi-nava q.v. (As a separate adverb or preposition) it expresses (with acc.) to , towards , in the direction of , against _ 61,1 L=11185.1

abhi abhi'

ind. into ŚBr. and KātyŚr. _ 61,1 L=11185.2

abhi abhi'

ind. for , for the sake of _ 61,1 L=11185.3

abhi abhi'

ind. on account of _ 61,1 L=11185.4

abhi abhi'

ind. on , upon , with regard to , by , before , in front of _ 61,1 L=11185.5

abhi abhi'

ind. over. It may even express one after the other , severally Pāṇ. 1-4 , 91 e.g. vRkSaM vRkSam abhi , tree after tree [ cf. Gk. $ ; Lat. ob ; Zend aibi , aiwi ; Goth. bi ; Old High Germ. bI]. _ MW008139 61,1 L=11185.6
